llm.feedback: The draft mixes mortgage‑rate and DXY views, violating the focus on us_mortgage_rates; remove the DXY lines, keep only mortgage‑rate items, and map each to ust10y (LF0UUL917) with a clear causal path; replace the “Fed policy unchanged + sticky inflation” line with a single‑sentence view that mortgage rates will stay in the 6.8‑7.2 % band through 2026 unless the September 16‑17 2025 Fed meeting cuts rates, and attach the catalyst window (9/16‑17 2025) and the 10‑yr yield change; drop the 2‑yr/10‑yr spread line because it is a rate‑level driver, not a mortgage‑rate driver, and instead add a line that a 25‑bp Fed cut on 9/20 2025 will lower mortgage rates by ~10 bp, citing LF0UUL917; adjust probabilities to reflect the 89 % chance of a 25‑bp cut (Z7O1DCHS7) and the 70 % chance of rate persistence (Z7O1DCHS7), and ensure each line ends with a single sentence, no filler, and includes the appropriate ID citations.
